Hi,

First off, let me introduce myself.
I'm a french developper working in=
 IT software compagny completely 
non related to IA. Well actually, I'm a c=
omplete newbie concerning 
IA ;).
Few times ago, I started a personnal proj=
ect that aims to evolve ANN 
with genetic programming for a simple food gat=
hering problem. I 
discovered NEAT and HyperNeat (and this group) by google=
ing the 
subject.
I'm still reading the litterature, and I sometimes do hav=
e hard time 
to fully understand the whole picture.
(Btw, sorry for my poor=
 english, I read a lot in english but I almost 
never write/spoke, and thus=
 I'm just loosing my skills over time.)

My question is quite simple. After=
 a quick look on HyperNeat package, 
I saw there is no mutation that shift =
the activation function of CPNN.
So I was wondering if this mutation could =
be relevant, and if Neat 
can handle this kind of mutation?
I think it coul=
d be done by simply disabling the neuron and add a new 
neuron with the sam=
e name but with a different innovation number.

Regards,
Greg.

PS: My apol=
ogies if the question is just stupid ;)
